image.altText: Rose Byrne Ruby the Roo

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate staff using $137,000 in taxpayer funds for personal travel expenses.

title.children: 'I'm shooketh': Tourism Australia calls in corruption watchdog over expenses scandal

image.altText: Dhirren Randhawa walks down stairs.

props.synopsis: 19-year-old Dhirren Randhawa pleads guilty to aggravated driving without due care and leaving the scene of an accident following the death of Charlie Stevens at Schoolies celebrations in November.

title.children: Teenage driver pleads guilty to lesser charges over death of SA Police Commissioner's son

image.altText: 2024-05-22T040053Z_887808317_RC26V7AK9PN0_RTRMADP_3_MEXICO-WEATHER

props.synopsis: As the world hits an alarming climate milestone, a new report by a US research team shows the staggering amount of extreme heat days each country experienced last year, with the majority made more likely by human-induced climate change.

title.children: In a year where every month was off the charts, one country saw 180 days of extreme heat. Usually it’s 10

image.altText: A view of a fast-food restaurant with yellow trim wrapping the building in its logo. A silver car is seen driving past.

props.synopsis: After opening its first restaurant in 2006, Guzman y Gomez is now weeks away from becoming a publicly listed company. Here's what it means for the Mexican-inspired fast-food franchise that wants to become as big as McDonald's.

title.children: Guzman y Gomez is listing on the ASX. Here's what it means for the Mexican-inspired fast-food chain

image.altText: A view of the side of a mountain with a part fallen off

props.synopsis: Under a mountain, a remote community quietly slept. Then a sudden landslide levelled a village.

title.children: How PNG's landslide obliterated a town: First there was a crack, then 'the stones came like a tsunami'

image.altText: Side of a green building with a sign that reads Precious Cargo Montessori Early Learning alongside three little cars

props.synopsis: Childcare chain Precious Cargo — which has seven operating centres across Adelaide —  is searching for a new buyer after going into voluntary administration this week.

title.children: Montessori childcare chain in SA goes into voluntary administration

image.altText: Waves crash onto Bar Beach, Newcastle.

props.synopsis: With Australian households spending an increasingly large chunk of their incomes on housing, it's no wonder some of us are looking for more affordable alternatives.

title.children: Australia's secondary cities outpace capitals for property growth over past five years

image.altText: A cruiseliner nexts to the Sydney Harbour Bridge

props.synopsis: P&O Cruises Australia is set to fold as its US-based company decides it's too expensive to operate the brand in Australia, with the news being labelled "heartbreaking" by experts.

title.children: American investors just helped kill off 'beloved' Australian brand P&O

image.altText: A large white cruise ship is parked at a berth.

props.synopsis: The Australian travel brand will fold its operations into parent company Carnival Cruise Line from March 2025, leaving passengers with cruises booked on the Pacific Explorer after that date to receive a refund or credit.

title.children: P&O Cruises Australia to shut its doors after 90 years, leaving Pacific Explorer to be retired

image.altText: Narendra Modi in a white shirt and blue vest holds his arms in the air making peace signs with his fingers at a rally

props.synopsis: Narendra Modi tells a crowd at his party's headquarters that his National Democratic Alliance will form government for the third consecutive time.

title.children: Opposition parties celebrate Narendra Modi's 'failure' to build a thumping majority in Indian election

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: Two political hotspots are whipping up Australians' anti-immigrant sentiment: the housing crisis, and the crimes allegedly committed by non-citizens released from detention last year. Yet neither crisis is truly caused by immigration.

title.children: Australian anxiety over immigration is about the perception of control. It always has been

image.altText: Novak Djokovic crouches low at the net preparing to play a forehand

props.synopsis: Champion Novak Djokovic pulls out of the French Open with injury, leaving Jannik Sinner as the new world No.1 men's player.

title.children: 'I had to make a tough decision': Djokovic pulls out of French Open with knee injury

image.altText: Man leaning on balcony railing with coffee cup, looking out to sea, small wallaby marsupial behind him, coastal background

props.synopsis: Ron Taylor lives most of the year wandering around his island home in solitude, living off-grid away from the pressures of the rat race. It's a "great lifestyle".

title.children: Ron could be a modern-day Gilligan living on his isolated island. But he has no desire to be rescued

image.altText: A woman and her dog in a tractor

props.synopsis: When farmer Melissa Smyth's not out on her property on the South Australian-Victorian border, she can be found painting or creating mosaics in her shed. Her new-found passion for art was sparked by what's known as the Pinnaroo Project.

title.children: This farming town has found a way to reduce depression and improve wellbeing in the bush

image.altText: Mosaic of lizard with snake it its mouth and planet

props.synopsis: What is a baby platypus called? Where is Planet Nine? Are you an uber geek? There's only one way to find out — take this quiz.

title.children: From snake-eating lizards to far-flung planets — do you have what it takes to beat the nerd quiz?

image.altText: A digital render of a train station at Melbourne Airport.

props.synopsis: The fight for a rail link to Melbourne Airport has been going for 60 years. With the state government struggling for funds and an operator unwilling to budget, the saga looks to drag on into the next decade.

title.children: Gloves come off in blame game over Melbourne Airport's rail fail

image.altText: Woman making coffee on an espresso machine

props.synopsis: The national accounts are likely to show living standards as measured by GDP per person have gone backwards for four consecutive quarters for the first time in 40 years. So why are we talking about a wages explosion?

title.children: Spare us the talk about a wages explosion. There's nothing wrong with lifting Australia's lowest wages in line with inflation

image.altText: A smiling young man with short, dark hair sits with his back to a bushy valley.

props.synopsis: Kye Schaefer, 21, died early last month in Coffs Harbour. A 36-year-old man has been charged with murder.

title.children: Murder charge laid after young surfer found stabbed in beachside car park

image.altText: A man sitting at a conference table inside an office, in front of a large window, clasping his hands and looking serious.

props.synopsis: The NT's chief minister says allegations NT Independent Commissioner Against Corruption Michael Riches offered his estranged wife $20,000 to withdraw a domestic violence order have been referred to the ICAC inspector, as he takes leave from the role.

title.children: NT ICAC commissioner agreed to pay wife $20k at same time she withdrew DV order against him

image.altText: Two wedding bands resting on a book.

props.synopsis: Antoinette and her wife are joining a growing number of Australians seeking "prenups". Lawyers say the harsh economic climate and growing number of parents giving children money is driving more people to consider them.

title.children: Lawyers reveal why Australian 'prenups' are on the rise

image.altText: An image of 'fake graffiti' in Paris - two spidermen, one Europe, the other US fighting over who to help Ukraine.

props.synopsis: A pro-Russian campaign is targeting Australian news organisations, including the ABC, according to international researchers.

title.children: ABC and Australian news outlets are in the crosshairs of a pro-Russian influence operation

image.altText: Man takes cash from ATM

props.synopsis: NDIS participants have been forced to hand over cash for criminals to buy drugs, and later harassed by the fraudulent providers.

title.children: How criminals are rorting NDIS participants for drug trafficking

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann defamation case

props.synopsis: Federal Court Notice of Appeal documents reveal former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann plans to challenge findings made against him in his failed defamation case on the grounds he was denied procedural fairness.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann says he was denied procedural fairness in failed defamation case, court documents reveal

image.altText: Two people in facemasks hug each other on an observation deck with a city horizon extending into the background

props.synopsis: Users will need to provide a tax certificate to prove their wage as well as a declaration that they are legally single and willing to get married.

title.children: 'A gentle push': Tokyo to release a dating app to try and boost Japan's falling birth rate

image.altText: A person holds a candle and flower, covered in a blue cloth looking sombre

props.synopsis: Hundreds gather in Taiwan to commemorate the 35th anniversary of China's deadly crackdown at Tiananmen Square, while mourners are arrested in Hong Kong and life continues as usual in China.

title.children: Silence in China and arrests in Hong Kong on anniversary of Tiananmen Square massacre

image.altText: A portrait of Julian Assange, depicted as a hot air baloon with a dove, an Australian $5 note and the US flag across his face.

props.synopsis: The WikiLeaks founder is the unlikely subject of a finalist in this year’s Archibald Prize. Here's how artist Shaun Gladwell covertly sketched him inside the walls of Belmarsh Prison.

title.children: How do you paint Julian Assange in prison? With a five-pound note and a bar of chocolate, of course

image.altText: Margaret Maughan

props.synopsis: A report highlighting the "missed opportunities" for people with disabilities at global sporting events hopes to create a "road map" for Brisbane's 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games.

title.children: 'Missed opportunities': How Brisbane's 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games can learn from the past

image.altText: A Centrelink/Medicare sign outside a branch.

props.synopsis: The average wait time to be assessed for the Disability Support Pension has tripled in four years. It's leaving people 'genuinely in crisis' without income support for months.

title.children: It now takes on average 107 days to have your Disability Support Pension claim assessed

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tam biscuits on a shelf, with a price tag saying $11.70

props.synopsis: The cost of living has increased more sharply in regional areas than in the cities, with some outback residents paying double for essential goods like food and fuel. Now the federal government is coming up with a plan to try to level the playing field, but will it work?

title.children: Is this Australia's most expensive town? Tim Tams cost $11.70 a packet or more than $1 a biscuit

image.altText: Interior of an aircraft looking down aisle.

props.synopsis: A quadriplegic teenager was unable to disembark a Virgin flight safely after the airline's own wheelchairs would not fit down the aisle of the plane, his mum says.

title.children: 'It's ridiculous': Quadriplegic teen stuck on flight because Virgin's own wheelchairs 'don't fit' plane aisle

image.altText: A large white balloon carrying a bad of trash hovers over a rice field.

props.synopsis: South Korea's military on Tuesday said it would resume all military activities along the demarcation line separating the two Koreas.

title.children: South Korea fully suspends inter-Korean military pact over garbage carrying balloons

image.altText: A man wearing a white jacket walks on the footpath with a woman around his left arm.

props.synopsis: An ACT Supreme Court jury is told it is operating in a court of law, not morals, as it prepares to decide the fate of a public servant charged with raping and assaulting his wife.

title.children: Canberra public servant faces court for allegedly raping, assaulting his wife

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a microphone in Congress while a red-haired boy makes a funny face behind him.

props.synopsis: A mischievous six-year-old has gone viral for upstaging his congressman dad in the US House of Representatives.

title.children: 'This is what I get for asking my son to smile at the camera': US politician's speech overshadowed by six-year-old

image.altText: A woman in military uniform looks through a pair of binoculars on the deck of a ship.

props.synopsis: Foreign citizens living permanently in Australia will soon be able to serve in Australia's armed forces, as part of an effort to boost sluggish recruitment.

title.children: Confusion over which foreign citizens set to be allowed to join the ADF

image.altText: Roll clouds in the sky.

props.synopsis: A strange cloud formation known as roll clouds have appeared in the skies across eastern NSW. Many Sydney residents have taken to social media sharing photos of the formation and questioned what the clouds are.

title.children: Rarely seen clouds have materialised over Sydney, but what are they?
